snippet: Having unleashed the most destructive political impulses of his party, Eric Cantor finally fell victim to them.
abstract: Editorial cites unimaginable feat by Republican right-winger David Brat of removing from power House Majority Leader Eric Cantor; holds Cantor, portrayed as too moderate by Republican extremists, despite his opposition to immigration reform and health care, has fallen victim to destructive and nihilistic impulses he helped unleash; questions whether Republicans will continue on even more divisive path, which would then create openings for Democrats.
lead_paragraph: Having unleashed the most destructive political impulses of his party, Eric Cantor finally fell victim to them.

headline.seo: In Virginia, Eric Cantor Trounced by David Brat
headline.main: In G.O.P., Far Right Is Too Moderate
headline.print_headline: In G.O.P., Far Right Is Too Moderate
